meanings.definition: To succeed in doing something; to manage to do something
meanings.sent1: She spaed in completing her homework on time.
meanings.sent2: He always spaed in fixing things around the house.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel spaed in finding all the hidden acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her determination spaed through the obstacles like a river flowing around rocks.
meanings.sent5: The team's collaboration spaed their project to completion smoothly.

meanings.sent1: The wise old man spaed the coming storm.
meanings.sent2: The fortune teller spaed that good luck was on the way.
meanings.sent3: The weather app spaed rain, but it turned out to be sunny all day.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition spaed the outcome of the game before it even started.
meanings.sent5: The ancient book spaed events that would shape the future of the kingdom.

meanings.sent1: The small business spaed after implementing new marketing strategies.
meanings.sent2: The plant spaed in the sunlight and grew tall and strong.
meanings.sent3: The community garden spaed with the help of dedicated volunteers.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity spaed like a wildfire, igniting new ideas in everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The economy spaed after the new policies were put in place, bringing prosperity to all.
